thread.title: Drink In D.C.'s Vibrant Coffee Culture
thread.title_full: Drink In D.C.'s Vibrant Coffee Culture

author: Adele Chapin
title: Drink In D.C.'s Vibrant Coffee Culture

organizations.name: hilltop bar & restaurant small chop d.c.

text:
Drink In D.C.'s Vibrant Coffee Culture All Feb 14, 2017, 5:47pm EST The Small Chop pop-up happening now at Hilltop Bar & Restaurant Small Chop D.C.'s coffee scene continues to experience robust growth. 
In the past two years, there has been a major influx of independent coffee shops opening in Washington, which means caffeine lovers have more places than ever to get their pour-over or nitro brew fix. Local success stories such as Compass Coffee are opening more outposts, and outside operators are getting in on the action too, with ongoing expansions around the city by San Francisco-based Philz Coffee and Philadelphia-born La Colombe . 
To keep track of it all, here are three dozen (and counting) of the DMV's best coffee shops: the latest sweep includes tried-and-true favorites such as Filter Coffehouse & Espresso Bar and Peregrine Espresso , as well as new arrivals such as a self-serve cold brew bar in Shaw — courtesy of Union Kitchen Grocery — and a pop-up near Columbia Heights featuring coffee from a fledgling small-batch roaster. 
— Adele Chapin 
Did we miss your favorite? Let us know in the comments. 1 Baked & Wired 
Some say Baked & Wired offers the city’s best cupcakes. Find coffee drinks from Stumptown Coffee Roasters, Intelligentsia, PT’s Coffee Roasting Co. and Elixr Coffee, milk from Trickling Springs Creamery and more. A second shop, called A Baked Joint, is now open in Mt. Vernon Triangle. 1052 Thomas Jefferson St NW Washington, D.C. 20007
